1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: ねぇねぇ　ペンギンさん

2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: 僕に向いてると思わない？
2.english: don't you think it's perfect for me? What? Your job at the zoo? Are you finally taking it seriously? No, I'm talking about living on my own.

4.japanese: 何　また家出するの
4.english: What, are you thinking about running away again?

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: 家出じゃないよ　一人暮らし
5.english: Not running away, living on my own.

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: パンダくんが？　無理でしょ

7.speaker: PENGUIN
7.japanese: パンダくんが？　無理でしょ
7.english: You, Panda? I don't think you're capable. {\a6}By myself.

10.speaker: POLAR BEAR
10.english: Fast reply {\i1}(sokutou){\i0}? That would be a wooden sword {\i1}(bokutou){\i0}. That would be fighting {\i1}(kakutou){\i0}. That would be a cafeteria {\i1}(shokudou){\i0}. That would be the hot water supply {\i1}(kyuutou){\i0}. Relaxation must be nice {\i1}(kyuuyou){\i0}. I'd like to take it easy sometimes.

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: いいよね　のんびり

12.speaker: PANDA
12.english: I want to live on my own.

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: いつものんびりしてるじゃない

14.speaker: PANDA
14.japanese: 違うよ　僕はのんびり 一人暮らしがしたいんだよ
14.english: No, I want to take it easy, living on my own. Living on your own is hard.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: 自分のことは 自分でしなくちゃいけないから
15.english: You have to do everything on your own.

16.speaker: PANDA
16.japanese: それがいいんじゃない
16.english: But that's what's great about it.

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: パンダくん　ひょっとして 過剰な夢見てない
17.english: Aren't you over glamorizing this a bit, Panda?

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.japanese: どういう生活考えてるの？
18.english: What kind of lifestyle are you thinking about?

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.english: On second thought, no, I don't.

22.speaker: PENGUIN
22.english: You're still going to tell me?

23.speaker: PANDA
23.japanese: 朝はね　大きなベッドで目を覚ますの
23.english: In the morning, I'm going to wake up in a huge bed.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: そしたら　カーテンが開いて
24.english: Then the curtains will open, and the skyline of the city will spread out before me. And then, below that, there will be a whole bamboo thicket.

25.speaker: PENGUIN
25.japanese: 都会なのか竹林なのか どっちかにしてよ
25.english: You need to decide between the city or the bamboo thicket.

26.speaker: PANDA
26.japanese: 起きたらね その景色を眺めながら…
26.english: After I get up, I'll be enjoying that view

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: 朝は　フレッシュジュースで目覚めるんだ
27.english: while waking up with a glass of fresh juice.

28.speaker: PENGUIN
28.japanese: それってもしかして　笹ジュース？
28.english: Is that juice going to be bamboo grass juice?

29.speaker: PANDA
29.english: And then after the bamboo grass juice...

30.speaker: PENGUIN
30.english: You're going to eat bamboo grass, right?

31.speaker: POLAR BEAR
31.japanese: 何だか　全体　緑だね
31.english: It looks like everything is going to be green.

32.speaker: PENGUIN
32.japanese: っていうか いつもと同じじゃない
32.english: Or rather, that isn't any different from how things are now.

33.speaker: PENGUIN
33.japanese: 一人暮らしなんて する必要ある？
33.english: Is there really a reason to live on your own?

35.speaker: PANDA
35.english: I'll hear a knock on the door...

36.speaker: PENGUIN
36.japanese: おはようございます　パンダ様

38.speaker: PENGUIN
38.english: Your schedule for the day is as follows:

39.speaker: PENGUIN
39.japanese: １０時からゴロゴロ　１２時からご昼食
39.english: Lazing around at 10 A.M., having lunch at noon,

41.speaker: PENGUIN
41.japanese: ３時のおやつののちゴロゴロとなっております
41.english: and lazing around after your 3 P.M. snack. That is all, sir.

42.speaker: PANDA
42.japanese: レストランに到着したら…
42.english: When I get to the restaurant...

44.japanese: お待ちしておりました　パンダ様
44.english: We have been awaiting your arrival, Mr. Panda.

46.speaker: PANDA
46.japanese: お店のテーブルについたら 豪華なディナーが用意されてるの
46.english: When I get to my table, there's a grand dinner waiting for me.

47.speaker: PENGUIN
47.japanese: どうぞ　お召し上がりください

49.speaker: PANDA
49.japanese: バイトの気分じゃないな
49.english: I don't feel like going to work today.

50.speaker: PANDA
50.japanese: 代わりに行ってきてくれる？
50.english: Could you go in my place?

53.speaker: PENGUIN
53.japanese: っていうか　それだと 一人暮らしじゃないよね
53.english: Or rather, that's not really living on your own, is it?

54.speaker: PANDA
54.japanese: 楽しくなってきたな 早く　一人暮らししたいよ
54.english: This is sounding really fun. I wanna live on my own as soon as possible!

55.speaker: PENGUIN
55.japanese: そんな物件あるわけないでしょ！
55.english: You're not going to find a place like that!

56.speaker: GUY
56.english: We have that. What?! An ideal place for living on your own, right?

57.speaker: GUY
57.japanese: ６畳に押し入れつきですから
57.english: It's six tatami mats in size, including the closet,

58.speaker: GUY
58.japanese: 一人暮らしには 広めだと思いますよ
58.english: so it's quite large if you're living by yourself.

59.speaker: GUY
59.japanese: ちゃんと　ゴロゴロもできますし

60.speaker: GUY
60.japanese: 窓からは　竹林も見えますしね
60.english: And you can see a bamboo thicket through the window.

61.speaker: PANDA
61.japanese: なんか　もうちょっと…　ワーッとして　ダーッとしてるのが いいんだけど
61.english: I'm looking for something with a little more "waaah" with a bit of "daaah." A little more "waaah" and a bit of "daaah"?

62.speaker: PENGUIN
62.japanese: 曖昧すぎるでしょ　パンダくん

64.speaker: GUY
64.japanese: ありますよ　ワーッとして　ダーッ
64.english: We do have a "waaah" with a bit of "daaah."

68.speaker: GUY
68.japanese: ワーッとしてませんか？

72.speaker: PENGUIN
72.japanese: パンダくんの理想が高すぎるんだよ
72.english: Your expectations are too high, Panda. Nah.

73.speaker: PANDA
73.japanese: 絶対どこかにあるはずだよ
73.english: My ideal single living house has to be somewhere.

75.speaker: PANDA
75.japanese: だって　ペンギンさんがいるもの あとは家だけでしょ？
75.english: I mean, you're here already, Mr. Penguin. I just have to find the house to put you in.

76.speaker: PENGUIN
76.japanese: 僕を理想の一部に 組み込まないでくれる？
76.english: How about we leave me out of your ideal living situation? It has to exist somewhere.

77.speaker: PANDA
77.japanese: 竹林！　そうそう こんな感じの竹林が理想だよ
77.english: A bamboo thicket! Yes! This is my ideal bamboo thicket!

78.speaker: PENGUIN
78.japanese: あっ…　ちょっ… ちょっと！　パンダくん！

80.speaker: PANDA
80.japanese: ワーッとして　ダーッとしてるよ！
80.english: It's totally "waaah" with a little bit of "daaah"!

81.speaker: PANDA
81.japanese: こんなところに住みたいな…
81.english: I want to live in a place like this!

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: はあ？　って… ここ　パンダくんちじゃないの？
82.english: Huh? Um, isn't this your house, Panda? What?

84.speaker: PENGUIN
84.japanese: やっぱり　一人暮らしする 必要なんて　ないんじゃない？
84.english: I really don't think there's a reason for you to move out on your own.

86.speaker: PENGUIN
86.japanese: アナグマくんじゃない？

87.speaker: PENGUIN
87.japanese: 何してんの？　物件探し？
87.english: What are you up to? Looking for a place to live?

88.speaker: BADGER
88.japanese: あっ… もう耐えられなくてさ
88.english: Oh, I couldn't stand it anymore.

90.speaker: BADGER
90.english: It was a big mistake. You should be listening to this, Panda.

91.speaker: PENGUIN
91.japanese: 一人暮らしって いいことばかりじゃないんだから
91.english: Living by yourself isn't all positive.

92.speaker: BADGER
92.japanese: フローリングの部屋はよくないよ　引っ越したい
92.english: I hate the wood flooring in my place. I want to move out as soon as possible.

93.speaker: PENGUIN
93.japanese: えっ　そうなの？ 掃除しやすくない？
93.english: Oh, really? Isn't it easy to clean?

94.speaker: PANDA
94.japanese: 掃除なら　ペンギンさんに 頼めばいいよ
94.english: You should ask Mr. Penguin to clean it for you.

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.japanese: だから　僕を召し使いにしないで！

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.japanese: どうして引っ越したいの？
96.english: Why do you want to move?

98.speaker: BADGER
98.japanese: 穴…　穴　掘れなくて…　もう辛くて　辛くて
98.english: Holes! I can't dig any holes and it's unbearable!

99.speaker: PANDA
99.japanese: え～…　そんなに辛いかな？
99.english: What? Is it really that rough?

100.speaker: BADGER
100.japanese: パンダくんでいうと　ゴロゴロを 止められるくらい辛いと思うよ
100.english: It'd be about as tough as you not being able to laze around, Panda.

101.speaker: PANDA
101.japanese: ハッ…　それは辛いね

102.speaker: PENGUIN
102.japanese: 他のみんなは　どんなところに 住んでるんだろうね？
102.english: I wonder what kinds of places everyone else lives in. Welcome!

103.speaker: PENGUIN
103.japanese: 近い　近い　近い
103.english: Too close, too close. Way too close.

105.japanese: ゆっくり　くつろいでください

106.speaker: PENGUIN
106.japanese: 近い　近い　近い
106.english: Too close, too close. Way too close...

108.speaker: PENGUIN
108.japanese: すごいね　コアリクイくん
108.english: Wow, impressive, Anteater. You have your own house?

109.speaker: ANTEATER
109.japanese: 買っちゃいました　３５年ローンです
109.english: I splurged and bought one! With a 35-year loan! Please come in and take a look!

110.speaker: PENGUIN
110.english: This is sort of a sad thought,but his kids might pay off that loan. Considering the average lifespan of an anteater...

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.japanese: あっ　ゾウガメさんだ
112.english: Oh, it's Mr. Tortoise. Where are you headed?

115.speaker: PANDA
115.japanese: 一人暮らし　見せてよ
115.english: Show me how it is living on your own.

117.speaker: PANDA
117.japanese: へぇ～　オシャレなマンションだね
117.english: Wow, this is a really fancy apartment.

120.speaker: PENGUIN
120.japanese: Ｓ？　それって何？　サービスルーム？
120.english: S? What's that? A service room?

122.speaker: PENGUIN
122.english: Very glamorous. Like a celebrity's apartment.

125.speaker: TORTOISE
125.english: It's for sand... This is my ideal... 2LS...

127.speaker: HANDA
127.japanese: あれ？ どうしたの２人とも
127.english: Oh? What brings you two here?

128.speaker: PANDA
128.english: Thanks for having us over. Wow, you keep the place pretty clean.

130.speaker: PANDA
130.english: Is this where you drink water?

132.speaker: PANDA
132.japanese: じゃあ　こっちが　水飲み場？
132.english: Then... Is this where you drink water?

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.japanese: 見直したよ　半田さん
134.english: I'm impressed, Mr. Handa. You keep your bath and toilet clean. Y-Yeah...

135.speaker: PANDA
135.japanese: あれ？　これで終わり？

136.speaker: HANDA
136.english: This is all of it. Well, I guess it's what I'd expect from you, Mr. Handa. I'll be fine right here.

137.speaker: HANDA
137.japanese: 何が？　どういうこと？
137.english: What? What are you talking about?

138.speaker: PANDA
138.japanese: 半田さんは そっちの奥で寝たら？
138.english: Why don't you sleep over there, Mr. Handa?

140.speaker: PANDA
140.japanese: 真ん中の段に 僕のものを入れるね
140.english: I'll be putting my things on the middle shelf.

141.speaker: PANDA
141.japanese: 勝手に笹ジュース飲まないでね
141.english: Make sure you don't drink my bamboo grass juice without permission.

143.english: Or rather, don't put anything in there!

144.speaker: PANDA
144.japanese: 自分のリズムで起きたいから 朝出るときは静かにしてね
144.english: I want to wake up on my own, so please be quiet when you leave in the morning. I'm telling you, don't sleep there!

145.japanese: バイトは　どうするの！？
145.english: What are you going to do about your job?

146.speaker: PANDA
146.japanese: 忠実なペンギンさんが 代わりに行ってくれるよ
146.english: My loyal Mr. Penguin will go instead.

147.speaker: PENGUIN
147.japanese: だから 召し使いにしないでってば！
147.english: I told you, stop making me your servant!

148.speaker: PANDA
148.japanese: ホントは 一人暮らしがしたいんだけど　しようがないよね
148.english: I really want to live on my own, but I guess it can't be helped.

149.speaker: PANDA
149.english: The three of us will manage somehow.

150.speaker: PANDA
150.japanese: じゃあ　僕　寝るから ご飯ができたら起こしてね
150.english: Well then, good night. Wake me up when the food is ready.

151.speaker: POLAR BEAR
151.japanese: で　半田さんに お風呂掃除するからって　追い返されたの？
151.english: So, Mr. Handa said he had to clean his bathroom, so you got the boot?

153.speaker: PENGUIN
153.japanese: まぁ　無理もない気がするよ
153.english: I can't say that I blame him.

154.speaker: SASAKO
154.japanese: パンダくん まだ一人暮らししたいの？
154.english: Do you still want to live on your own, Panda? I gave up on that.

155.speaker: PANDA
155.japanese: あっ　でも 召し使いは見つけたよ
155.english: Oh! But I did find a servant. Right?

156.speaker: PENGUIN
156.japanese: 僕のことも諦めてくれる？
156.english: Could you give up on me, too?

157.speaker: SASAKO
157.japanese: 今日は　しろくまカフェと グリズリーバーのジョイント企画で
157.english: Today we're having a collaboration between Polar Bear's Café and Grizzly's Bar

161.speaker: POLAR BEAR
161.japanese: 似合ってるね　笹子さん
161.english: That looks good on you, Miss Sasako.

162.speaker: SASAKO
162.japanese: みんなで盛り上げましょう！

164.speaker: GRIZZLY
164.english: Leave the festival to me! I'll burn it up!

166.speaker: POLAR BEAR
166.japanese: グリズリーくんは 焼そばを作ってね

167.speaker: GRIZZLY
167.japanese: おう　ガンガン作ってやるぜ

168.speaker: POLAR BEAR
168.japanese: パンダくんは ソースを塗ったりする担当
168.english: You're in charge of applying the sauces and such, Panda.

170.speaker: POLAR BEAR
170.japanese: ペンギンさんは　呼び込みで
170.english: You'll be in charge of gathering the crowd, Mr. Penguin.

172.speaker: LESSER
172.japanese: あの　僕も何か お手伝いしましょうか？
172.english: Um... is there anything I can help with?

173.speaker: PANDA
173.english: Oh, it's been a while! Is he a friend of yours, Panda?

175.speaker: ALL
175.english: Older brother? Or something like that... What's your relationship? He's a relative that has the same name

176.english: but is from a different family.

178.speaker: LESSER
178.japanese: もともと　パンダって呼ばれてたのは 僕たちだったんですよ
178.english: We were the ones that were originally called pandas.

179.speaker: SASAKO
179.japanese: へぇ～　そうだったんですか

180.speaker: LESSER
180.japanese: でも　ジャイアントパンダくんが 出てきてから
180.english: But since the appearance of giant pandas,

181.speaker: LESSER
181.japanese: 僕たちは 小さいほうのパンダ　レッサーパンダって 呼ばれるようになったんです
181.english: we started being called lesser pandas.

183.speaker: PANDA
183.japanese: 今も　笹情報まわしたりとか
183.english: We still exchange information about bamboo grass

184.speaker: PANDA
184.japanese: 親戚づきあいは 続いてるんだよね
184.english: and get together for family gatherings.

186.speaker: LESSER
186.japanese: はい　どこの笹が おいしいとか調べたり
186.english: Yes. Like finding the best places for bamboo grass.

187.speaker: LESSER
187.japanese: 僕たちも　笹　大好きなんで
187.english: We like bamboo grass, too, so we try to work together.

189.speaker: SASAKO
189.japanese: じゃあ　私は　注文や お客さんをさばいたりするから
189.english: Then I'll be waiting on customers and taking orders,

190.speaker: SASAKO
190.japanese: お勘定係　お願いしてもいいかな？
190.english: so could we ask you to ring people up?

193.speaker: GIRL
193.english: This is the one I want!

194.speaker: POLAR BEAR
194.japanese: そう　そう… これを立てておこう
194.english: Oh, yeah. I should put this out.

196.speaker: GRIZZLY
196.japanese: どんなサービスするんだ？
196.english: What kind of special are you offering?

200.speaker: POLAR BEAR
200.japanese: でも　これを見たら
200.english: But if people see this sign,

201.speaker: POLAR BEAR
201.japanese: 今買わなきゃって思う
201.english: people will think they should buy it now!

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.japanese: いらっしゃい　いらっしゃい！
203.english: Come and get it! Come and get it!

204.speaker: PENGUIN
204.japanese: シロクマ風お好み焼と グリズリー焼そばだよ
204.english: We've got Polar Bear style okonomiyaki and Grizzly yakisoba!

205.speaker: PENGUIN
205.japanese: 一度　食べたら　忘れられない味
205.english: Once you eat it, you'll never forget it!

206.speaker: PENGUIN
206.japanese: しかも　めったに食べられないよ
206.english: Not to mention, you rarely get the chance to eat them.

207.speaker: GRIZZLY
207.japanese: え～い！　まどろっこしい！！
207.english: Damn it. This is too slow! Yeah! Take that and that and that!

208.speaker: GRIZZLY
208.japanese: グリズリー焼そばの激うまさに驚け！
208.english: Be astounded by the deliciousness of Grizzly yakisoba! Take that and that!

209.speaker: POLAR BEAR
209.japanese: グリズリーくん　勢いよすぎ

211.speaker: GIRL
211.japanese: お好み焼　１つと　焼そば　１つ！
211.english: I want one okonomiyaki and one yakisoba!

213.speaker: SASAKO
213.japanese: 焼そば　３つと　お好み焼　１つ
213.english: Can I get three yakisoba and one okonomiyaki, please!

216.speaker: SASAKO
216.japanese: パンダくん　早く　お好み焼　お願い！
216.english: Please hurry with the okonomiyaki, Panda! Oh, right... Right away! I just got sauce on myself.

217.speaker: GRIZZLY
217.english: Come on! Hurry up! O-Okay. There.

218.speaker: GRIZZLY
218.japanese: ぐわっ！　何しやがる！？
218.english: What the hell are you doing? It was backwards.

219.speaker: GRIZZLY
219.english: Change with Sasako, damn it! Here you go. Yay!

221.speaker: BOTH
221.japanese: ありがとうございました

222.speaker: SASAKO
222.japanese: うりきれ！　店じまいです
222.english: We're sold out! We can close up shop now. Thank you all for your hard work. Thanks. Thanks, everyone.

225.speaker: PENGUIN
225.japanese: パンダくんは 途中で　クビになったでしょ
225.english: You got fired partway through, remember, Panda?

226.speaker: POLAR BEAR
226.japanese: 他の屋台回ってみようよ
226.english: Let's go around to the other stands.

228.speaker: PANDA
228.japanese: わぁ～！　たくさんあるね

229.speaker: PANDA
229.english: I'm gonna get this one! Panda in panda.

232.speaker: PANDA
232.japanese: パンダ　アンド　パンダ

233.speaker: PENGUIN
233.english: That's scary. Wow! That looks fun! I wanna try!

234.speaker: PENGUIN
234.japanese: また　そんな ご迷惑なことを…

235.speaker: GUY
235.japanese: いいよ　やってみるかい？
235.english: Oh, do you want to try?

237.speaker: PENGUIN
237.japanese: 別の生きものに なっちゃってるよ
237.english: You've turned into a completely different creature. My tongue won't reach!

239.speaker: PANDA
239.english: One more time! One more time!

241.speaker: PANDA
241.japanese: 銃がよくないよ　おじさん　交換して
241.english: This gun doesn't work. Can I get another one?

242.speaker: PENGUIN
242.japanese: また　そんなワガママ言って
242.english: Stop being such a nuisance. I did it!

247.speaker: GRIZZLY
247.japanese: 俺にかかりゃ　こんなもんよ
247.english: That's what happens when you mess with me! Here you go.

248.speaker: LESSER
248.japanese: あ…　ありがとうございます
248.english: Th-Thank you. They're too damn small! I'd get them in one swipe if they were salmon or trout!

249.speaker: SASAKO
249.japanese: シロクマさん　すご～い
249.english: You're amazing, Mr. Polar Bear! That's your 20th one!

251.speaker: GRIZZLY
251.japanese: いっそのこと　直に…
251.english: How about I handle this more personally?

252.speaker: GUY
252.japanese: お客さん　困ります
252.english: Sir, please don't... Oh, Mr. Handa.

253.speaker: HANDA
253.english: Oh, hey, Panda. I just finished work and got here. Where's Miss Sasak— I mean, the stand?

254.speaker: PANDA
254.japanese: うん　完売で もう　みんな遊んでるよ
254.english: Oh, we sold out, so everyone's off having fun.

257.speaker: HANDA
257.japanese: 笹子さ…　あ　いや！みんなに差し入れをと思って…
257.english: Oh, this is for Miss Sasako— I mean,for everyone to share.

259.speaker: PANDA
259.japanese: 笹子さんなら　あっちにいるよ
259.english: Miss Sasako is right over there.

261.speaker: PANDA
261.english: Let's go give them to her.

263.speaker: PANDA
263.japanese: みんなじゃなくて ２人で飲めばいいと思うよ
263.english: I think just the two of you should drink them together.

269.speaker: PANDA
269.japanese: 半田さんが 差し入れにきてくれたよ
269.english: Mr. Handa brought us something. H-Here.

270.speaker: SASAKO
270.japanese: あら…　ありがとうございます

271.speaker: PANDA
271.japanese: いやいや　つまらないものだから

272.speaker: HANDA
272.japanese: ちょっと…　パンダくん

273.speaker: GRIZZLY
273.japanese: おう　半田 ありがたくもらうぜ
273.english: Thanks, Handa. I'll gladly take it.

276.speaker: LESSER
276.japanese: せっかくなんで いただきます
276.english: Well, since you offered, I'll take one.

277.speaker: HANDA
277.japanese: あ…　どうぞ　どうぞ
277.english: Oh, yes. Please help yourselves. {\a6}Hey, do you have any alcohol?

278.speaker: PENGUIN
278.japanese: 半田さん…　間が悪いなぁ
278.english: Mr. Handa just can't catch a break. {\a6}How about seal meat? {\a6}I'm sorry. I didn't bring any...

280.speaker: SASAKO
280.japanese: 始まったみたいですね

282.speaker: SASAKO
282.japanese: 私　花火　大好きなんですよ

283.speaker: HANDA
283.japanese: 僕も…　僕も大好きです
283.english: Me, too. I love them, too.

284.speaker: SASAKO
284.japanese: いいですよね　花火
284.english: Fireworks are so amazing. Sure are.

285.speaker: HANDA
285.japanese: 笹子さんは座ってください
285.english: Please have a seat, Miss Sasako.

287.speaker: PANDA
287.japanese: ダメだよ　半田さん　遠慮してちゃ
287.english: Come on, Mr. Handa. Don't hold back.

288.speaker: PANDA
288.japanese: でも　これで 一緒に並んで座れたでしょ？
288.english: But now you were able to sit together.

289.speaker: HANDA
289.japanese: あ…　あの…　最後の１本に なっちゃいましたが

291.speaker: SASAKO
291.japanese: ありがとうございます

292.japanese: すごく　ノドが渇いてたんですよ

294.speaker: PANDA
294.english: So pretty! Burn it up! Burn it up!

295.speaker: POLAR BEAR
295.japanese: グリズリーくん　それ違うから

297.speaker: PENGUIN
297.japanese: もう…　みんな 空気読まないんだから
297.english: Jeez, you guys are so dense.

298.speaker: PANDA
298.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

300.speaker: PANDA
300.japanese: ぺんぎんさんって十回言うと呪われるっていう噂
300.english: Can I spread a rumor that whoever says your name ten times will be cursed?

302.speaker: PENGUIN
302.japanese: そう簡単に呪われたら大忙しだよ
302.english: If it was that easy to curse someone, I'd be way too busy.

303.speaker: PANDA
303.japanese: じゃ　ペンギンさんが考えた
303.english: Then could you tell us  the non-stingy way

304.speaker: PANDA
304.japanese: せこく思われないように割り勘って言い出す方法を聞かせてよ
304.english: of saying "splitting the check" that you came up with?

305.speaker: PENGUIN
305.japanese: 海でする話じゃないだな
305.english: I don't think we should discuss that at the beach.

307.speaker: POLAR BEAR
307.japanese: 来週のしろくまカフェは急ぎ足でお送りします
307.english: Next week's Polar Bear's Café will be presented at breakneck speed.

308.speaker: PENGUIN
308.english: Let's do it slow and steady.
